title: American_Top_40_1976_October_30th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

This is the first time in chart history the a new act (England Dan & John Ford Coley) has had both of their first two songs on the chart at the same time.

Firefall also has their first hit.

One singer in the countdown couldn't get any success recording original songs, but after she switched to doing remakes, her carreer took off. Casey gives the details.

You'll never guess which song in the top 10 has spent eighteen weeks in the top 40.

Casey tells a great story about an artist in this countdown who started 1976, $250,000 in debt, and stood to gross $50 million by the end of that year.

This is one of several broadcasts where Casey recounts the life of the world's first disc jockey, Al Jarvis.

Two segments contain only bumber music. We have people here who drink.
